trends: There have been no other sightings in Mackey
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsWhile setting off a few fireworks with my 2 boys, ages 12 & 9yrs, we noticed a large orange ball in the western sky. Thinking it was going to be a firework display, I stated to my boys, "here comes a big one" but it never exploded. It moved in a straight horizonal line at about 45 degrees fromt the horizon and moved due north, never rising or falling from that line of view. It moved at a consistant speed towards the north until it disappeared from sight, this being approximately 30-45 seconds. It did not blink or flash and no sound was heard. I'm sure a few of the surrounding neighbors witnessed the same thing because the fireworks suddenly ceased until it moved out of sight. I quickly contacted a friend, a NASA Embassador with her own observatory, to question if anything was scheduled to be in the sky at that time....nothing. I don't know what it was but it sure sparked my interest and couriousity.
